customers package¶

Submodules¶

customers.models module¶

class customers.models.Customer(full_name, username, password, age, address=None, gender=None, marital_status=None, wallet_balance=0.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a customer in the system.

full_name¶

The full name of the customer.

Type:

str

username¶

The unique username of the customer.

Type:

str

password¶

The password for the customer (should ideally be hashed).

Type:

str

age¶

The age of the customer.

Type:

int

address¶

The address of the customer. Defaults to None.

Type:

str, optional

gender¶

The gender of the customer. Defaults to None.

Type:

str, optional

marital_status¶

The marital status of the customer. Defaults to None.

Type:

str, optional

wallet_balance¶

The wallet balance of the customer. Defaults to 0.0.

Type:

float, optional

charge_wallet(amount)[source]¶

Adds funds to the customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

amount (float) – The amount to add to the wallet.

deduct_wallet(amount)[source]¶

Deducts funds from the customer’s wallet if sufficient balance exists.

Parameters:

amount (float) – The amount to deduct from the wallet.

Raises:

ValueError – If the amount exceeds the available wallet balance.

to_dict()[source]¶

Converts the customer object to a dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary representation of the customer object, suitable for API responses.

Return type:

dict

static charge_wallet(username, amount)[source]¶

Charges a specified amount to a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to charge.

Returns:

True if the operation was successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Deducts funds from a customer’s wallet if sufficient balance exists.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to deduct.

Returns:

True if the operation was successful, False otherwise.

Fetches a customer record from the database by username.

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

The customer object if found, otherwise None.

Customer or None
